channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nurses with three New York health systems have been on strike this week
item.description: New York City's nurses strike could go on for weeks. Nurses are seeking better pay and protection from violence on the job, among other things. The hospital systems say the price is too high.
item.content:encoded: New York City's nurses strike could go on for weeks. Nurses are seeking better pay and protection from violence on the job, among other things. The hospital systems say the price is too high.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Lewis

item.title: ICE surge sparks fear and resistance in Minneapolis
item.description: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.content:encoded: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: As focus shifts to denaturalization, what protections do foreign-born Americans have?
item.description: The Trump administration is looking to expand efforts to strip naturalized Americans of their citizenship. An immigration attorney weighs in.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is looking to expand efforts to strip naturalized Americans of their citizenship. An immigration attorney weighs in.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: Major California highway re-opens after three-year closure
item.description: A section of an iconic California highway has reopened after three years. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rhea Withrow, who lives in a town that was isolated during the closure
item.content:encoded: A section of an iconic California highway has reopened after three years. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rhea Withrow, who lives in a town that was isolated during the closure
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: Why reliving 2016 is the new social media trend
item.description: Social media users, in 2026, are reliving 2016 nostalgia online. We answer the questions swirling around why and what this means.
item.content:encoded: Social media users, in 2026, are reliving 2016 nostalgia online. We answer the questions swirling around why and what this means.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: Pianists celebrate Morton Feldman's 100th birthday with two marathon concerts
item.description: The experimental composer Morton Feldman would have turned 100 years old this week. To celebrate, more than a dozen pianists played two marathon, six-hour-long concerts of his work in Los Angeles.
item.content:encoded: The experimental composer Morton Feldman would have turned 100 years old this week. To celebrate, more than a dozen pianists played two marathon, six-hour-long concerts of his work in Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Intagliata

item.title: Comedian Tig Notaro on finding humor in the heaviest of moments
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Tig Notaro talks about admiring the way her friend handled death.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Tig Notaro talks about admiring the way her friend handled death.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the clues to look for
item.description: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the warning signs they watch for before the bubble bursts.
item.content:encoded: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the warning signs they watch for before the bubble bursts.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Guo

item.title: Immigration enforcement becomes a flashpoint in Minnesota Senate race
item.description: Immigration is shaping up as a key issue in the race for Minnesota's open U.S. Senate seat, with Democratic candidates trying to navigate how they respond to a surge in federal agents in their state.
item.content:encoded: Immigration is shaping up as a key issue in the race for Minnesota's open U.S. Senate seat, with Democratic candidates trying to navigate how they respond to a surge in federal agents in their state.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: In California, a 'super bloom' of death caps sparks mushroom poisoning outbreak
item.description: This winter, California is seeing the largest outbreak of mushroom poisonings in at least the past three decades. In a typical year, there are five; this year, there have been 35.
item.content:encoded: This winter, California is seeing the largest outbreak of mushroom poisonings in at least the past three decades. In a typical year, there are five; this year, there have been 35.
item.dc:creator: April Dembosky
